instructions:
Add G Washington seasoning mix to milk and heat in a 2-quart pot, not quite to scalding; set aside. Fork
oysters through fingers into a small bowl looking for shell pieces. Reserve liquid. Melt margarine in a 4
quart pot, over high heat, until bubbling *(do not scorch)*. Quickly add oysters, liquid and water and toss
lightly with fork until edges of oysters just begin to curl. They should remain plump. Remove from heat
immediately. DO NOT OVERCOOK. Pour milk over oysters, add salt, Worcestershire, wine and pepper.
Serve in warm bowls with oyster crackers. Serves 4.

*(Rev. 2/4/97)*
ingredients: 1 envelope G Washington Brown seasoning mix
name: Oyster Stew
creator: Jim Decker
